intro: Dolicholus caribaeus, commonly known as the Caribbean dolicholus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Dolicholus caribaeus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
